div.p: High-pressure XANES study of sulphur speciation in crude oil.

Left (Fig. 1). The reference S K-edge XANES spectrum of the crude oil from West Siberia (top blue curve) and a sequence of spectra of the same sample insite the diamond anvil cell taken as a function of time (top to bottom). The star mark shows a feature at ~2482 eV, coming from the sulphur contamination of the diamond windows. Two arrows indicate spectrl features, specific to the sample radiation damage: a growing pre-edge peak at ~2468 eV and a reducing feature at ~2454 eV.

Right (Fig. 2). XANES spectra of the natural oil sample as a function of pressure at ambient temperatures. No changes in the sulphur oxidation state were observed, and the small spectra changes are probably attributed to the radiation damage.
